headline: U.S. Shale Bets on Efficiency Gains Amid Budget Cuts
summary: U.S. shale is in “wait-and-see” mode as WTI lingers in the low–mid $60s: producers are trimming capex, deferring completions, and leaning on efficiency gains rather than chasing growth

raw.headline: U.S. Shale Bets on Efficiency Gains Amid Budget Cuts

headline: Can Ongoing Debt Reduction Boost the Prospects of Occidental Stock?
summary: OXY's $7.5 billion debt cut, lower interest costs and asset sales boost flexibility and support growth prospects in energy and low-carbon projects.

summary: Occidental Petroleum's biggest investor could end up selling stock this year.
